subject_terms_3: Indian National Army (Singapore) Indian National Army Monument Site periodicals
physical_appearance: This clipping is page 23 from the periodical 'The Orient Illustrated Weekly' published on 3 February 1946. The left side of the page comprises of three articles. A photograph at the bottom left of the page shows two cadet officers from the Indian National Army posing with a group of women. The right column of the page features two advertisements. The edges are slightly torn, especially at the bottom.
sgcool_label_text: "Prior to the World War II period, Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political, sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions, inspired by the ""call for freedom"" in India
title_text: The Orient The Orient Illustrated Weekly
